questions.questionText: What are the different types of testing in Android?
questions.correctAnswer: Unit tests (test individual functions/classes), Integration tests (components working together), UI tests (user interaction and app behavior).
questions.explanation: Unit: logic in isolation. Integration: verify multiple pieces. UI: simulate real user scenarios.

questions.questionText: What is JUnit and how is it used in Android testing?
questions.correctAnswer: JUnit is a popular Java/Kotlin testing framework with annotations and assertions.
questions.explanation: Provides @Test and assertion methods (assertEquals, assertTrue, etc). Needed for unit/instrumented tests.
